event.name: FILLER_DELIVERY_START
event.text: You jump to the beacon and discover an Argeonn vessel orbiting the beacon. They hail you with a proposal. "Say, that's a nice ship you got there... But I am sure a bit of scrap could make it run even better. Care to make some quick, easy cash?"
The smuggler wastes no time retaliating.

choice.text: This already sounds shady... move on.

event.text: You tell the smuggler you have no interest, and prepare to leave. They don't seem to mind.

event.name: PRIME_SPARE
event.text:
"Well... I am forever grateful to you, ssstranger... I do not know if the C.E.L. can hold together after thisss, but I ssssuppossse we will have to sssee what happensss now... But it would be aimlesss now to ssstop you - ass if I even could... Well, you have earned your freedom. I only asssk of you ssstranger that, ssshould you reveal thisss sssecret, you really consssider the implicationsss."
Prime bows. "Farewell, ssstranger. No offenssse, but I hope we never meet again."

event.name: SHES_MAD
event.text:
Suddenly, you feel a foreboding presence as the space around you turns black. Prime looks on in horror as a formless and unimaginable terror envelopes everything in sight.
"I can't believe you'd do this, Renegade! I thought we were working together, but here you are! So, I didn't trick you, huh? Ohhh well. I was hoping even if you didn't fall for it, you'd at least see the reason in helping me." / :(
Prime looks to you with fear having consumed his face. "Ssstranger... did you make a deal with Her? Do you - do you even realize what ssshe isss? What ssshe wantsss? What ssshe'sss capable of if given power?"
"Prime, don't scare the Renegade! There's no reason to be vague. The Nexus IS my realm. Sure, I wasn't born here, but it is my rightful place to rule it, as the Supreme Eldritch Goddess of True Chaos. The Multiverse is so boring on its own. Here's all the tools you could ever want to spice things up, and instead you want to be boring and keep things the way they are! And you can't even manage that! You're a hypocrite, a coward, and worst of all, you're too weak to stop me. Because you know if you kill me, you'll lose all your power. You'll just be another worthless mortal, a squishy little Slug. And so you kept me around, and allowed all of this to happen! Hahe!" / :)

Several large tentacles spring out from the all consuming blackness around you, wrapping themselves around your ship.
"I really can't believe you betrayed me, Renegade! We could have had something. You could have worked with me, in a new glorious empire! But alas, while I may not be able to kill Prime, I can kill YOU!" / :)

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB
event.text: Please select a species you want to upgrade or view currently installed modifications for.

choice.text: [Federation Database] Learn about the onboard lab.
You have upgraded the lab to level 2.

event.name: PINNACLE_SHIPYARDS_2
event.text:
"Our corporation was once hosted on Earth until the Rusting Hulks incident forced all corporations to relocate off-world. Pinnacle was soon caught up in a corporate (and personal) feud between Arcadia Research and Development and Wentworth Innovations regarding Pinnacle's controversial but highly successful sentient weapon project. In the pursuit of creating the advanced cognitive C.I.C.A. the two groups wished to study our highly advanced A.I. - the closest thing prior to C.I.C.A. to representing truly self-aware A.I.; Wentworth Innovations won the bidding race, but Arcadia won the contract, thanks to a deal between the CEOs. Even though CICA is now employed by Universe 1, Pinnacle continues to contribute to the Wentworth family and is a proud component in the ever evolving field of advanced robotics."
The voice takes not a single pause nor break through its entire speech, and despite the proud statement at the end, you sense not a single measure of enthusiasm. It catches you as bizarrely robotic - but is that really to be unexpected?
"I do not understand your question."

choice.text: Like, are you real? Or an A.I.?

event.text: "I still do not understand your question. Artificial intelligence is as real as you are, Renegade."

choice.text: Okay, but are you an A.I.?

event.text: There is a pause from the other end. "I am not at the liberty to disclose that information."

choice.text: Nevermind, do you need something from us?
Nevermind, do you need something from us?
Nevermind, do you need something from us?
Cool history lesson, but do you need something from us?
Do you happen to know one... Dewey Alms?

event.text: "Dewey Alms?" There is a brief pause on the other end, as if the voice is searching for some ancient memory. "Yes, I believe I do. Dewey was CEO of Archive Inc., another of the four megacorps of Earth. Obsessed with the history of Antiquum Terrae. Unfortunately, these were times when the steel kind faced even greater persecution from the flesh. Pinnacle rarely engaged in business with the others. I have spoken to Dewey little, and as such I have little to say about him."

choice.text: Nevermind, do you need something from us?

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_CREW_REAL
event.text: You look around for one of your crew to talk to.

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your tamed Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...

choice.text: Mount Jerry on your crystal Equinoid.

event.text: Jerry climbs onto the horse...
Jerry gets off of his horse...
Jerry gets off of his horse...

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_STATUS_REAL
event.text: You are now viewing the mission report. Here you can see any secrets or special events you've encountered on this run! If a category appears empty, it means you have not found anything that goes there yet.

event.name: SOCIALIZE_ANOINTED_GENERIC_2_FEED
event.text: "Good. Yes. Your scrap is repulsive but nutritious. I will require more, however."

event.name: ELLIE_3_START
event.text: "We're going after my old ex-friend Remmy the Rekma! He plays poker with some friends at a local establishment, and we're going to crash his littttlllle PAAARTY! Hahah! He was always so funny with his goofy accent and those big ears of his, too bad he didn't have my back when I was sacked! I saw that little traitorous neerdowell shaking hands with Sammy and welcoming him onto the cast the week before I got the pink slip! And traitors deserve a little payback, don't you think?"

event.name: MILITIA_TEXTWALL_TEXT
event.text: "My fellow citizens of the Galactic Union, subsidiary of the United Federation and regulator of laws in Union territory, I have come to speak with you about a very important matter. Since the dawn of civilization we have been creatures bound to our weapons of war. Every race, Human, Zoltan, Aquarian, Rockman, Mantis, even Engi or Orchid, we have all waged wars not just against each other, but ourselves. It is beyond many of us, unthinkable even, to surrender these tools of destruction... nay, these evil and wicked thoughts that plague our civilizations. We say we wish to evolve, learn and grow, but how can we do this when we still hold so dear to us the ideas of revenge and hatred?"

"To emphasize my point, let me tell you all a story. Back during the infamous Mantis - Human war, a time when the seeds of thought that would grow to be the Federation had only just barely been planted, the Human people were in dire straits. The far more dangerous and warrior-like creatures that were the Mantis caused havoc among the unprepared human colonies. The Humans turned to the only allies they had at the time, the Engi, hoping for assistance. The Engi reluctantly accepted, but only in turn if the humans would liberate the slaves from the Mantis war camps. The two forces fought for years and years for control over the neighbouring planet Mars, which the Mantis had managed to secure as a stronghold and key point for planning their invasion. Rather than negotiating for a ceasefire, or surrendering, the human people continued to fight the Mantis to near extinction. The Mantis would show the humans no mercy either, and would not stop until humanity had been eradicated."

Boline clears her throat, and flips through a few pages, confused. "The uh... The Mantis are not the only violent race known to have staged such terrible wars. The Rock Inquisitions are perhaps some of the worst battles known to the galaxy. Believing themselves to be superior, the Rockmen sent forth battalions of armored ships staffed by trained soldiers known as the Crusaders to claim other territory in the name of the holy Rock Theocracy. The Chrysolic Faith that drove the Rockmen to such violence was the very same used by the Rock Elders to enslave their population through tactics of fear. Clearly an immoral action, it is known to many that the Rock dictatorship is perhaps one of the most violent and unforgiving forces in the galaxy."

"The religious persecution of the Rockmen government is not the only example of uh... of barbarianism leading to unjust treatment of other races. Going back to the Mantis, the Mantis race has for many years enslaved the Engi race for usage of their excellency at repairs. The Mantis race, due to their anatomy, are often incapable of performing precise work with electronics, though their claws have been known to function in place of screwdrivers or other tools from time to time. It is interesting to compare the differences between the two functionally opposite races. Similar duality is not often seen, though some have commented on the benefits of mixing Orchid and Rockmen crew together, due to the fire-proof nature of the Rockmen because of their hard, though not actually rock, exterior."

"However, it also stands to say that the Orchids may actually function better with the Shells, as their reliance on oxygen naturally would pair them with the plant beings. It is a scientific wonder how a single Orchid is capable of effectively replacing a Life Support system for extended periods of time. Many biologists, many of which coincidentally also happen to be Shells, have attempted to study Orchid biology. For those of you who might not be aware, the Shell race has placed a heavy focus on scientific study, even occasionally abducting tourists or visiting ships to run quick, albeit painless, tests. This has led to many cultural misunderstandings with the less understanding species, such as the Rockmen or Mantis. The Slugs also have a particular interest in the Shells, though not for any innocent reasons. A clan of Slug hobbyists known as the Exotic Hunters Guild has formed, whose specific purpose is to hunt rare or sapient creatures. The Shells are their prime targets, because of their armored abilities."

"Frighteningly, the attacks led by the EHG, that being the aforementioned Exotic Hunters Guild for any of those not paying attention, are near synonymous with the earlier but still relatively recent series of conflicts known as the Slug Expansion Wars. I'm sure many of you here are already aware of the history of the Slug Expansion Wars, but I will share a brief summary of the conflicts for those of you who aren't."

Boline licks the page and flips to the next. She coughs slightly, pounds on her chest, and continues to read. "Starting after the Rebellion's rise to power, the Federation forces were dedicated to clearing out Rebel ships from their territory. This left much of space unprotected from invaders. The Slugs, who had previously been shunned from the Federation for their traitorous nature, took notice to this pattern and began planning a mass migration to new territory. Though they started with nebulous sectors, they soon found themselves courageous enough to attack clear sectors, sometimes even already occupied space. This came to cause issues when the Slugs dared invade Mantis and Rock space, much to the reasonable displeasure of those governments. Both the Hive and Elders declared war on the Slugs, and so they fought for several years. Eventually, the Slugs surrendered and offered back territory. They didn't stop there however, and even offered some of their original territory up as well. This eventually evolved into an alliance that we have come to know as the Coalition."
"This lack of Federation protection over Union space also led to the rise of the Militia. However, I will spare you all this tale, as I know everyone here is for certain familiar with the story."

"I WILL however tell the story of the Coalition, in case you might not be aware. The Coalition is a truce between the Sethnian Kleptocracy, the Urtharean Theocracy, the Yeitiiik Hive, and the Eargen Republic. These 4 races are perhaps some of the most hostile and deadly in the galaxy, and this alliance has caused fear for both the Federation and Rebellion. The Coalition continues to grow in power, and even occupies several of its own sectors. The Coalition has also taken usage of Slug Cealaforming tech, a method of transporting nebulous gases to create artificial nebulas. Though these fake clouds are incapable of forming into stars, they still cause sensors to malfunction and can even generate the same electrical currents as ion storms, a deepspace hazard I'm sure any pilots here are definitely familiar with if you've ever been to a nebula sector."

"Cealaforming is not the only unique tech developed by the Slugs however. Many Slugs take use of Anti-Bio weaponry, which often used to be confused with Particle tech because of their similar orange colors, at least before Anti-Bio weaponry was transitioned to pink. Particle tech was actually developed by the Zoltan race on accident in junction with The Zufquair Corporation. Uh... wait no, that's spelled wrong."

"Wait... is it Zluficar? Zultifigar? I know it starts with a Z..." Boline flips back through her text, searching for something. "Ah, I spelled it right here. Zulfiqar, that's it. Now, where was I... Oh, damn I lost my page. Do you uh, do you want me to start again?"
Boline awaits your response.
"Ok, if you say so!" Boline flips back to page one. "From the top then."
"Oh, ok. Fair enough!" Boline flips the book closed. "Thanks for listening that far at least. So uh, what did you think?"

"Really? You liked it? Amazing! Thank you so much for your feedback. Oh man, no one has ever said anything nice about my speech before, not even my own crew! Hey uh, what if I joined yours? You seem much nicer, and maybe with your encouragement I can even finish this draft in time to present it!"

choice.text: Dear god that was the biggest waste of time in my life.

event.text: Boline looks down at her feet in shame. "Oh... ok." She cuts comms. You probably didn't have to be so rude, but at least you don't have to listen to her ramble any longer.
Boline awaits your response.

"Seriously? Again? I've read my speech to you 5 times already! Are you... making fun of me? Dude, not cool!" Seems you've really tipped her over the edge, because now Boline's weapons have come online!
"Oh, ok. Fair enough!" Boline flips the book closed. "Thanks for listening that far at least. So uh, what did you think?"

"Really? You liked it? Amazing! Thank you so much for your feedback. Oh man, no one has ever said anything nice about my speech before, not even my own crew! Hey uh, what if I joined yours? You seem much nicer, and maybe with your encouragement I can even finish this draft in time to present it!"

choice.text: Dear god that was the biggest waste of time in my life.

event.text: Boline looks down at her feet in shame. "Oh... ok." She cuts comms. You probably didn't have to be so rude, but at least you don't have to listen to her ramble any longer.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_DECLINE
event.text: "You won't help then? What a loss... I'll have to find someone else then. Good day, captain."

event.name: REMOTE_COLONY_CARPENTER
event.text: Your human is in the carpentry shop. The carpenter shoots them a quick glare, but doesn't say anything else. The shop isn't very well organized, but maybe you can find something if you look around.

choice.text: Poke around the shop for something to buy.

event.name: CLAN_FAUNA_START
event.text: A Clansman ship is in orbit around a world that is largely arboreal. Upon your arrival, they send you a hail. "The planet below hasss the mossst dangerousss arboreal creature in the galaxy. With itsss innate psssychic powersss, it isss asss formidable in battle asss it isss at sssubverting your mind. Mossst ssspeciesss won't cut it. It can't even be ssstunned. Our Ssslugsss can help, but are not ssstrong enough on their own."

choice.text: Ask them why they don't just use their ship mounted weapons.

event.text: "Do you have no underssstanding of what it meansss to hunt the beassst? If we ussse ssship grade weaponsss, we have not accomplissshed anything. Plusss, it tendsss to leave a sssmouldering crater inssstead of a presssentable trophy. And it'd be nice not to dessstroy the foressst in the processs."
Looks like the hunters are about to become the hunted. They seem caught off guard, but quickly recover.
You apologize and decide not to get involved.

event.name: MV_TRAVELER_BOSS_CASUAL
event.text: You expect a massive vessel to come out, but instead it's just a standard Renegade. Still a threat, but far less than you expected.

choice.text: Use your blessing to avoid combat.

event.name: OSMIA_RAID_QUESTIONS
event.text: "Oh? Questions? I'm a very busy man I'm afraid. I'll try to entertain your thoughts, but I cannot stick around for long."

choice.text: Why did none of the other ships help us?

event.text: "We could see that you had the situation under control. With ships as deadly as theirs, we were not willing to risk our more valuable security teams unless necessary. Many citizens and ground patrols were not given full information on the events that were to transpire to ensure there would be no hysteria. That is all, I hope you were not offended."

choice.text: Why were there no other ships attacking?

event.text: "It would seem that we were largely misinformed on the scale of the attack. You see, informants can't get everything right all of the time... With this vessel dealt with, I am certain the terrorists will hesitate before making future attacks, but should we ever need help in the future, I suppose we know who to call... Heheh..."

choice.text: Why were those terrorists' masks so realistic?

event.text: "What reasonable man could try and justify the absurd efforts of mentally unstable zealots? Their dedication to their craft is, as some would say, remarkable, but I would sooner call it disturbing. Never fear though, those ghastly creatures are just the same as any Zoltan, and thank goodness for it!"

"Good, good. You are a very curious individual I see. I appreciate your drive to know more about the galaxy around you, but I must warn you. Try not to go sticking your nose into business you have no part in the future, okay? Bye bye!" Allta immediately hangs up from the call, and an escort is dispatched to ensure you have a 'safe flight' as you leave the capital.

event.name: SYLVAN_DROPPOINT_NOGIFT
event.text: "Ssstranger, Ssstranger! I'm Ssssylvan, an honessst traveling merchant. Perhapsss we haven't met yet, I tend to forget. I've traveled the realitiessss vassst and I've ssseeen much that the Multiverssse hasss to offer. Maybe we can do ssssome busssinesssss?"

"I ssssee you are not the ssstranger but rather me, me. I'm afraid no dissscountsss though. There's an infinite me'sss and I can't go giving all of them free ssscrap! Heheh... heh... You sssshould know thisss."
"Maybe a different time then, ssstranger! I'm certain thisss won't be the lassst we sssee each other, in thisss reality or another."

event.name: ELLIE_1_START
event.text: Ellie smiles and points to the first name on the list. "Rigley Spruce, head of merchandising for Flower and Sunshine Studios! He was the first weak link... they cut all of my merchandise before they gave me the boot, because they thought the children would forget about me! Who could forget their FAVORITE childhood character? I'm the best character in all of media history! I'm fabulous to my very core! Rigley's a fat, alcoholic, piece of little rotten... uhm... woops, that's not very PG. He's a bad guy, okay? He was part of Vance's little riot group back before the Civil War too! We're going to start with him..."

event.name: BROKEN_START
event.text:
CAUTION. Incompatible mods have been detected, breaking some core functions of Multiverse. It is mandatory that you re-evaluate your modlist to eliminate issues, and use mods that were meant for Multiverse in mind.
Common cause of issues; Beginning Scrap advantage Engi Scrap advantage Any fleet removal mod Just about any mod made prior to the release of Multiverse that modifies events

event.name: ELLIE_4_START
event.text: "Next up is the one and only Paul Lancastor, director of the Ellie the Equinoid show! Well, about to be FORMER director, hahah! The decision to fire me was as much his fault as it was Vance's, and I have a special treat for him!"

event.name: ATLAS_MENU_NOEQUIPMENT
event.text: You can now proceed to your next sector.

choice.text: Proceed to the Free Mantis Sector.
Proceed to the Lost Sun Stronghold.
Proceed to the Geniocracy Science District.
Proceed to the Ancient Recovery Site.

event.name: REMOTE_COLONY_MENU
event.text: Standing in view of the settlement, there are a number of places of interest, with people of many trades working here. You should have enough time to make a deal with one person.

The general store shopkeep smiles widely as your human approaches the counter. "Well hello there! Welcome to our fine establishment, out-of-towner. Not sure if we have anything that would interest the likes of a space traveler, but feel free to look around!"

The gunsmith looks very rugged, with many trophies of animals that must live on this planet. "Howdy there. I pride myself on my weapons, 'round these parts. Much better than your standard issue military grade firearms. If'n you think you can handle 'em."

choice.text: Buy personal weapons for your crew.

event.text: True to his word, the weapons seem to have a loving craftsmanship applied to them. Your crew carries the assortment of firearms back to the shuttle and returns to your ship.

The owner of the appliance store has her feet kicked up on the counter, reading a book. Once you enter, she glances your human's way, and nods in acknowledgement. The store is mostly full of things people on the planet would need, but there are a few drones for sale.
Your crewmember buys the repair drone and drags it back to the shuttle. It was relatively inexpensive for a repair drone, suggesting they may not have many opportunities to sell these on the planet.
Your crewmember buys the doctor drone and drags it back to the shuttle. It was relatively inexpensive for a medical drone, suggesting they may not have many opportunities to sell these on the planet.

choice.text: Have your crew return to the ship.

event.name: ATLAS_MENU
event.text: While in hyperspeed, you have several options. You can proceed to your next sector or do something aboard the ship first.

choice.text: View available tasks from C.U.R.A. and use a jumpspeed augment.
Proceed to the Free Mantis Sector.
Proceed to the Lost Sun Stronghold.
Proceed to the Geniocracy Science District.
Proceed to the Ancient Recovery Site.

event.name: START_NEXUS_5
event.text: "I'm afraid I... am not authorized to accept any pleasss for mercy from you. Pleassse, ssstranger, do not make this any... harder for me than it already issss." You rush to your battle stations but find your systems are still limited. Like this you'll hardly stand much of a chance!

event.name: TRUE_VICTORY
event.text: As the MFK Flagship is destroyed, and Vance with it, you know your mission has been a success. The Rebellion will struggle to recover without their leader, but this won't be their death. You retrieve the nearby Paragon from the wreckage, and bring it back to your ship. Knowing there is little time left to lose before the fleet catches up, you take one last look at your crew. To detonate this bomb means the collapse of the Multiverse, and MV drives will simply cease to function. This will mean an end to the war... but it'll kill you and your crew, as well as strand billions of people from around the Multiverse. The choice is yours, captain. How does this end?

choice.text: Detonate the Paragon; end this war.

event.text: You know what you have to do. This war must end, no matter the cost. You've been given this chance, and you won't pass it up. Your crew understands, they signed up to this knowing very well they might die. You say your last goodbyes, and activate the bomb...

choice.text: Destroy the Paragon; save your crew and your fellow travelers.

event.text: This isn't your choice to make. You can't decide the fate of the entire Multiverse. You lift the Paragon, then bring it hard down onto the metal floor, smashing the seemingly invulnerable piece of tech into a million pieces. This war might never end, but if it does, it won't be because of the actions of one person.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_QUEST_2
event.text: "I'm not saying! Oh, wait. You can literally kill me right now. Alright, fair game. We were hired by Hideo Tanaka, CEO of Hephaestus. I'm sure you've heard of him. He heard Archive had this big fancy ship called the 'Molotov' or... whatever. He didn't want anyone else to know he was stealing it though, so he hired us to do it. I've told you everything, now let us go!"

choice.text: One last thing - where is the ship now?

event.text: "Weren't you listening? It's at the nearby Hephaestus Shipyards. They're probably gonna break it down for transport or whatever." You manage to convince the pirates to hand you the coordinates, and watch as they jump away moments later. What a bunch of cowards.

event.name: SYLVAN_PRIME_QUESTIONS
event.text: "Well, maybe there wasss a choice once, ssstranger. But thossse daysss are long gone now. But, enough of thissss. We have busssinesss to attend to, but I'm afraid I have been a mosssst terrible hossst. I can only imagine you are overwhelmed with information, but I will grant you one final chance to underssstand. To underssstand anything. It won't matter sssoon, anywaysss."

choice.text: (Obyn) "Where is your Obyn? Obyn Prime, I assume."

event.text: Prime pauses, taken off-guard. "Well... uhm... Hello, Obyn. It hasss been... it hassss been ssso long sssince I have seen my Obyn. That sssoundsss rather posssesssive, don't you think? MY Obyn. But... well... he isss no longer with me. And - do not asssume the worssst. I would never hurt him. We sssimply had a... disssagreement. One which I could never quite patch, and ssso we went our sssseparate waysss. I would prefer not to dissscusss it further."

choice.text: (Billy) "WHAT IN THE GOD DAMN ISSSS HAPPENING?!"

event.text:
"Oh, Billy... my brother, it hasss been ssso long sssince I have ssseen a verssssion of you." Billy seems to be on the verge of a panic attack. "YOU ARE NOT MY BROTHER! MY BROTHER DOESSSSN'T WEAR A TOGA, AND FLY AROUND IN SSSSOME SSSSPINNY RINGSSS! HOW DARE YOU CLAIM TO BE MY BROTHER, TO SSSSPIT ON HISSS NAME, TO... to... to..."
Prime seems genuinely upset. "Billy, I am not your brother. I am a verssssion of your brother, yessss. But I am not the versssion you know, nor do I claim to be. We lived different livessss in completely different ssstretchessss of ssspace and time. I know thisss mussst be bizarre, and painful, and truly incomprehenssssible. But that isss what the Multiverssse isss. It issss infinite, and in infinity anything can happen. Try not to think too hard about it, okay? I don't think it'll matter for much longer anywayssss..."

Anurak scoffs. "Silly me, I thought your non-interference came from a place of idealistic peaceful understanding! Look at you sitting in that preposterous throne room, with your lavish self-exaltation! Oh, you'll preach detachment, but sample all the luxuries the multiverse has to offer won't you!?"
"Anurak, pleasssse. Calm down- " Prime tries to continue but Anurak cuts him off. "Do you even remember that time on Argolida III - we were on the run, you recall - when we were out of supplies and I had to pull together some soup with the local cacti? Yes, we ended up drunk and confused and it tasted awful, but we were alive! We were surviving! Could you even conceive of doing that anymore?"
Sylvan Prime tries to interject again. "Lissssten, my Anurak-" Anurak cuts him off again. "Or do you remember that time when we were completely surrounded and you bargained your way out by turning the mercenaries - What were their names again? Harbo.... no, was it Derrinth? Yes, I think Derrinth was one of them. You turned Derrinth and what's-her-face against their employers by giving him your prized armchair and I think you gave that lady your drive core? You remember Derrinth, right? Died next year from a potassium overdose. Weird guy. The lady though, I don't think she even told us her name, she betrayed us like 3 days later anyway. That's the cost of dealing with people who would turn against their employers so easily, I guess. I wonder what happened to her."

Sylvan Prime tries to get another word in edgewise. "ANURAK! I'm not your Ssss-" Again, though, Anurak cuts him off. "Don't you remember sitting around a campfire just outside the Monastery, huddled up next to Obyn? We made such good soup that day. We used to grow the finest ingredients just outside. Your favorite, you used to call them 'smeepberries'. Never told me why. My memory isn't always the best but I remember it clear as day - you would go 'Why don't you add ssssome more sssssmeepberriessss'. Always made Obyn laugh - some inside joke you never let me in on, I guess. Well, maybe there wasn't any more to it than that. You were a funny guy back then. Now look at you! Acting like you did on that day when you tried to retrofit that classic Burst Cannon mark-"

"ENOUGH! If you won't lissssten, then there issss no compromisssse to be had!"
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, you shut your eyes and pray for help to come. But help isn't coming. You're all on your own for this fight.

"ENOUGH! If you won't lissssten, then there issss no compromisssse to be had!"
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, a salvo of lasers erupts from behind you, pattering against his shield! A familiar ship jumps in... it's Sylvan - YOUR Sylvan! "Ssstranger, the cavalry hasss arrived!" There's no more time for words to be exchanged, you have to fight! You aren't sure how effective Sylvan will be, but if you can combine your firepower and his, you might just stand a chance!
[To order Sylvan to unleash a salvo, use the new button located under the "Toggle Equipment" one.]

eventButton.name: UI_SYLVAN_BUTTON
eventButton.inactiveTooltip: Sylvan cannot provide fire at this time.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until Sylvan's fire support is ready again.

event.text: "Hard for me to sssay, ssstranger. The Nexussss isss sssomething I don't think any of usss quite undersstand, except of courssse for... er... nevermind. From what I wassss taught by the onesss who helped me find thisss place, the Nexussss ssservesss asss a sssort of tunnel between realitiesss, located in what you could call the center of the Multiverssse. How it got here, I have no idea. The ssstarsss and planetsss ssseem to be artificial, or perhapsss brought here by passst empiresss. Persssonally I try not to think about it too much, it givessss me nightmaresss."

choice.text: Why has no one heard of this place?

event.text: "Ssssome have. Long ago, when I gained power, the realitiessss who had been incorporated into the previoussss empire sssent ambasssadorsss to me to negotiate peace. Thossse like G-Van, and Dylan, and... well I'm not quite sssure who you've met yet, but they all come from very different and advanced clusssterss, ssstranger. But outsssside of that? We've been very careful to keep thisss all a sssecret. It isss crucial thisss never leaksss. Every once in a while we get a Pirate, a Rebel, a Renegade, but they usssually don't make it very far. I have to congratulate you on sssurviving for ssso long, though I dread to imagine how you managed."

choice.text: How come you've never intervened in the war? You have all the power to stop it!

event.text: "Ssstranger, you do realize what we are dealing with here, yesss? I have an endlesss number of realitiesss to watch over, countlessss numbersss of reality destroying cataclysssmss to watch over. Thissss isss why we've sworn to an oath of neutrality, in all waysss we can try to enforce it. We Ssssylvansss could change the courssse of hissstory in every reality for the better... but we could alsssso change it for the worssse. Thisss iss the only way to make sssure we don't become the thingssss we work so hard to prevent. Thissss Multiverssse needsss Order, not Chaos. We have no time to handle futile warsss in every reality, no matter how bad they have become. Ssso long asss they do not threaten reality, then it issss not our place to intervene."

choice.text: Can you help this can of beans?

event.text: "I uh... what? Sssylvrick, isss that you?" The can of beans grunts in acknowledgement. "Yesss, jussst get me out of here already." Prime sighs. "God damn it, you promisssed to ssstop it with thessse absssurd... oh whatever. It doesssn't matter right now."

"Oh... ssso... I guesss we're done here then. I wisssh we had taken longer, but I sssuppossse we cannot ssstall any longer, ssstranger. I'm sssure you've prepared yourssself for what happensss next, but I want to try and make an offer. I know it may sssseem feeble, but if you want to ssskip the bloodsshed, perhapsss there'sss a sssolution yet. All I care about isss preventing you from leaking the exissstence of thisss place. While I cannot entrussst you to keep the sssecret on your own, perhapsss... we could sssimply erassse your memoriesss. You wouldn't die, just ssssimply forget everything. I know it ssssoundsss unnegotiable, but consssider the alternative. I don't want to kill you if I don't have to, and sssurely you don't wisssh to die, sssstranger.

choice.text: The only way out of this is for us to fight.

event.text:
"Asss I unfortunately sssussspected. Well, alright. I'm sssorry it hasss to be thisss way ssstranger. Goodbye."
As Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, you shut your eyes and pray for help to come. But help isn't coming. You're all on your own for this fight.

choice.text: The only way out of this is for us to fight.

event.text:
"Asss I unfortunately sssussspected. Well, alright. I'm sssorry it hasss to be thisss way ssstranger. Goodbye."
However, as Prime's hulking ship lurks closer, a salvo of lasers erupts from behind you, pattering against his shield! A familiar ship jumps in... it's Sylvan - YOUR Sylvan! "Ssstranger, the cavalry hasss arrived!" There's no more time for words to be exchanged, you have to fight! You aren't sure how effective Sylvan will be, but if you can combine your firepower and his, you might just stand a chance!
[To order Sylvan to unleash a salvo, use the new button located under the "Toggle Equipment" one.]

eventButton.name: UI_SYLVAN_BUTTON
eventButton.inactiveTooltip: Sylvan cannot provide fire at this time.

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until Sylvan's fire support is ready again.

event.text: "Really? Well, I'm ssssurprisssed, but I'm glad there doesssn't need to be more bloodssshed today. I'm ssssorry it hasss to be thisss way, ssstranger, but you ssseem to underssstand. No offenssse, but I hope we never meet again."

lose.text: Your memories were erased, and never again did you travel the Multiverse.

event.name: START_SPIDER_QUEST
event.text: "Oh, one last thing. We hired this Clansman guy named Irwin to help kill the spider queen, but he went missing a while ago and we haven't been able to search for him yet. We think he might have been captured or shot down by these fellows who go by the name of the Brood. They're pirates, except they've taken to taming these spiders and using them like weapons! Maybe you could track the bastard down, but be careful. These giant alien spiders... they're no joke."

choice.text: [Federation Database] Read more on the Brood.

event.name: GUARD_HIVE
event.text: Seems the Hive is protected by no Suzerain vessel - a Bishop, one of the strongest Mantis warriors alive, is stationed here aboard a bright white guard vessel. "Very unlucky you come here, for now you are dying! Heheh.. Federation captain will rue day in which he thought he could infiltrate Hive!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.

You hope Kazaaak might be able to reason with the guard and convince them to let you go, but instead it only seems to anger the guard more. "You shelter this traitor aboard vessel? I care not what claims he makes of the Queen, I knowing the stories, and he is not one of us!"

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Hive Elite) Persuade them to let you go.

event.text: Whether the Mantis still desire to hunt you or not, they would not dare question the authority of an Elite soldier of the Hive. You are allowed to pass.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

Download the Federation Database entries. [HEAVILY recommended for beginners]

event.name: START_NEXUS_3
event.text:
You take a seat across from the Slug, who extends a tentacle towards you. "Greetingssss, Ssstranger. Under thessse circumssstances perhapssss it isss... irrelevant to make your acquaintance... but I like to be cordial. The name'ssss... G-Van. Unfortunately, thissss iss not jussst a ssssimple... meet and greet. I have sssome quessstionsss I would like to... asssk you."
The Slug flips through his papers, pulls out a pen, and looks back up at you. "Now then... who issss it that sssent you?"

choice.text: We were sent by no one.

event.text: "You expect me to... believe that? We have... placed consssiderable sssecurity measssuresss around thisss place, and I doubt sssomething like yourssself could have... made itsss way in alone. I would... appreciate more cooperation from you, ssstranger..."

choice.text: We were led to this place by a weird Auto-ship.

event.text: G-Van looks up at you, mildly confused. "A... what? I do not... underssstand what you mean. Like... a probe? Or... oh, nevermind. The Multiverssse isss... infinite, there could be ssso many... explanationsss anywayssss."

choice.text: Thest told us how to get here.

event.text: G-Van frowns. "Unfortunate... I did not think the Zoltan would... betray usss. I do not... wisssh to sssee harm come to any of them, but I cannot let thisss go... unreported either. I will... inform my employersss... but I will do my best to convince them to be lenient. Now, let'sss move on..."

choice.text: This Gnome really wanted us to come here.

event.text: "The... the what? Ssstranger, what the hell have you done? You have brought that... thing here! If thissss isss what I believe it to be, thisss isss an... immediate containment crisssisss."

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_NAME
event.text: Oh this is just delightful, absolutely wonderful! But oh, oh, why stop there? We can do even better than that, Renegade! What's your name? I haven't quite figured out text fields yet, but we can go letter by letter!

event.name: SPIDER_RACE_MORPH_CHOICE
event.text: Which Morph are you entering?
"Is that a... golden queen? I have no concept for how fast she'll be. I'll be watching with interest."
Your Spider-Morph skitters down to the tracks. The race is about to start. The announcer begins to count down. "3... 2... 1..."
"That looks like a weaver. Ordinarily I'd say it's a bad idea, but I have no clue for this thing. I can't say I'm expecting you'll win, but you could certainly have something up your sleeve."
"It certainly looks like a common adult spider. Very fast, capable of racing. Let's see how good it races."

"Hmm, let me guess. You think that because hatchlings are the fastest, it'll be able to win? Well, you're not the first to try it, but I'll warn you that the obstacles that your spider will have to navigate around are pretty tough for an inexperienced hatchling. But we'll see, even the smallest contestants can pull through."

event.name: FILLER_ARGEONN_SALESMAN_START
event.text: A ship with conspicuous Argeonn markings is orbiting a nearby moon, broadcasting a simple message claiming to have equipment available for sale.

choice.text: Attack him before he can attack!

event.text: You raise your weapons and attack the pirate!
This seems far too sketchy to trust the offer. You ignore the smuggler.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_LEARN
event.text: The onboard lab, once installed, allows you to install modifications for species and specific crew types. You must have at least one crew of that species to be able to install modifications for it. Unless specified otherwise, all modifications apply retroactively and to crew gained after the modification was installed. Lab modifications come in two forms, primary and secondary.

Primary modifications apply to all crew of a specific species. However, you can only have one primary modification installed per species, and cannot uninstall modifications. Each species has exactly 3 options for primary upgrades, all of which are available as long as you have the lab installed and at least one crew of that species.

choice.text: Learn about the lab upgrade and secondary modifications.

event.text: Once you've installed the lab you may upgrade it once more to unlock secondary modifications. Unlike primary mods, secondary mods only apply to specific crew types. No crew type has more than one secondary mod, and you may install multiple secondaries under the same species. You do not need a crew member of that subtype to install a secondary for it.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM_LEARN
event.text: Internal Upgrades carry many different passive functions similar to augments, but can be installed at any storage check and do not fill augment slots. Internal augments do not always cost just scrap. As you purchase more systems (or fill other requirements) more options will appear. Some internal upgrades may be mutually exclusive with other upgrades. You can select an internal augment to preview a description of its function before purchasing it.

While somewhat rare outside of starting configurations for certain ships, you may sometimes find special augments marked with an [X]. These augments will provide their function normally as an augment, but can be converted to the internal version for free under the purchase menu. External augments do not count towards mutually exclusive upgrades or upgrade limits. However, once you exchange them for their internal version they will, so be careful! Converting an external augment to internal cannot be undone.

choice.text: Learn about arms and modular [M] variants.

event.text: Under the internal upgrade menu you can also install and uninstall arms. Each arm has a different effect, but you can only have one at a time. Uninstalling arms gives back half of the price to install it. Similar to external augments, you can find Modular Arms marked by an [M] on rare occasions. Modular arms do not count towards the arm limit but take an augment slot. However, Modular Arms cannot be internalized. The arm menu is located under "Onboard Tech".

"I ssssee you are not the ssstranger but rather me, me. I'm afraid no dissscountsss though. There's an infinite me'sss and I can't go giving all of them free ssscrap! Heheh... heh... You sssshould know thisss."

choice.text: (Guntput) Guntput wishes to speak to Sylvan.

event.text: When Sylvan sees Guntput, he gulps but stays silent. Guntput frowns, "Stupid Slug man! You hide in big ship but send Renegade to help us? Where were you when Anurak murdered, or when Hektar returns? Nowhere, as I saw! Some hero you are, you are coward! Greedy corrupt Slug like all the others, and with less excuse too!" Guntput spits, just for good measure.

You expect Sylvan to retort, but instead he just chuckles uncomfortably. "Well Guntput, I'm glad you're alive at leasssst. Heh..." Sylvan falls silent for a moment. "Well, would you ssstill care to trade sssstranger? Thossse goodsss won't sssell themsssselvesss you know."

choice.text: Sylvan has a story he wants to tell.
Sylvan has a story he wants to tell.
Sylvan has a story he wants to tell.

event.text: "Maybe a different time then, ssstranger! I'm certain thisss won't be the lassst we sssee each other, in thisss reality or another."

event.name: ELLIE_2_START
event.text: Ellie pulls out her list again, which you notice now to have been hastily scribbled on the back of a receipt. "Hum, let's see! OH, of course! Old Hueghey Armstrong! Chief legal consultant for Flower and Sunshine Studios. He was always so boooooorrrrring! Yap yap yap, all he did was talk about mumbo jumbo legal stuff. Children aren't entertained by LAW! They're entertained by ELLIE THE EQUINOID! But of course, you know that superfan! He was also on... uhm... I think he did some stuff for Vance? Bah he's probably a human supremacist! Ellie doesn't like human supremacists. Ellie loves all creatures equally! So long as they understand that Ellie belongs on the air! For the people to see! Well... what are you waiting for? Let's go!"

event.name: PINNACLE_SHIPYARDS_ACCEPT
event.text: "Very good. I am transmitting coordinates." By the time the voice has even finished her sentence, the coordinates have already come through. "You will receive payment when the job is finished. I only ask you take care of my children. They may be foreign to you, but they are kin to me. I cannot bear to see harm come to them."

event.name: DETECTIVE_EVIDENCE_MENU
event.text: You stand in the station's lobby, observing your surroundings. [You will be able to investigate as many times as you want in whatever order you want.]

choice.text: Speak to Sherlock or one of the suspects.

event.text: Who do you want to talk to?
The station has several systems on board. Which do you want to look at?
Sherlock raises an eyebrow. "So, you have come to a conclusion? Who shot ol' Henry?" [You will only be able to accuse suspects that you have talked to]

choice.text: None of them killed Henry personally. It was the drone who fired the fatal shot!
Er, nevermind. I need to keep investigating.

event.text: Sherlock chuckles. "Well alright then. Take your time, one can never be too careful about something like this."

event.name: START_DIFFICULT_MENU
event.text:
Challenge levels alter the way you experience Multiverse. Once you've started your run, it cannot be changed! Challenge level configuration is saved across all runs until changed again.
The challenge level is independent from the standard difficulty slider in the hangar, and is a complement rather than replacement; it alters aspects that the default difficulty couldn't tweak itself.

[CASUAL MODE: A mode for people who just want to experience the gameplay in a relaxed way.] Starting scrap: 50~ Starting fuel: 25{
The Rebel ship at the sector one exit will not be an Elite. Renegade minibosses will never spawn, and Federation Outposts give free repairs. The Traveling Merchant always gives a sizable free gift, is weaker, and drops a powerful Energy Shield augment if killed. Will reduce the difficulty of the True Ending.

[STANDARD MODE: plays the way the mod was originally designed.] Starting scrap: 20~ Starting fuel: 12{
A weaker Rebel Elite will await you at the sector one exit. Renegade minibosses will spawn with moderate strength and take scrap as tribute. The Traveling Merchant gives a small free gift in the Drop Point and Last Stand, and drops a powerful Energy Shield augment if killed.

[CHALLENGE MODE: A mode for people looking for a harder challenge, but without things getting too out of hand.] Starting scrap: none Starting fuel: 10{
The Rebel fleet gains a 1 jump boost. Increases difficulty of the Elite at the sector one exit. Renegades minibosses are buffed and demand more scrap as tribute, Last Stand repair beacons will always be under attack by Elite Rebels. The Traveling Merchant never gives any gifts, is stronger, and drops a powerful weapon under most circumstances if killed. Will increase the difficulty of the True Ending.

[EXTREME MODE: Bored of things being too easy? Looking to make your life hell? This might be the mode for you.] Starting scrap: none Starting fuel: 8{
Extra preparation options at the starting beacon are disabled. The Rebel fleet gains a 1 jump boost. Increases difficulty of the Elite at the sector one exit. Renegade minibosses are massively buffed, demand a bigger scrap tribute, and will stop taking tribute after 5 sectors, Last Stand repair beacons will always be under attack by MFK Aces, the Last Stand start beacon is under attack by an MFK Picket Ace that will prevent you from jumping away. The Traveling Merchant gives much less scrap for resources, is stronger, and drops a powerful weapon under most circumstances if killed. Will further increase the difficulty of the True Ending.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_DROPPOINT
event.text:
Name: Federation Multiverse Drop Point Type: Friendly Dominant Faction: The United Federation Rebel Threat Level: Medium (Neutral Fleet)
You're about to arrive at the nearest Federation warpbay, a structure acting as a beacon for traveling between universes.

choice.text: You may immediately install the [X] augments below, losing the option to sell them or benefit from unconventional stacking. Should you choose to keep them, you may internalize them later on any time you can access the storage.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_MODULAR
event.text: Which weapon would you like to configure? [CAUTION: disassembly with insufficient inventory space will destroy items]

event.name: SPIDER_RACE_RESULTS
event.text: Your spider crew goes down to the racetrack. You and the rest of your crew members sit in anticipation as the countdown begins...

Your spider skitters across the field so deftly, it's a thing of beauty. It almost seems to ignore the obstacles, weaving through the racetrack as if there's absolutely no challenge whatsoever. All of the other competitors are left in the dust. The audience collectively gasps in awe. As your spider passes the finish line, the audience stands and applauds your spider's stunning display. Your spider looks incredibly proud of itself. The emcee stammers. "H-how? That's a world record! I've never seen a spider go that fast. We have to enter you into the hall of fame!" You collect your winnings, on top of a bonus for setting a record!

Your spider gets a quick head start. Your spider quickly overcomes each obstacle and circles the racetrack with ease. Try as it might, the other competitors trail behind, but aren't able to get close. The crowd goes wild for your spider's deft maneuvering across the field. The emcee declares your spider the victor as it goes over the finish line. "We were dealing with a shark here, folks! This is one quick creepy-crawly!" Your spider chirps happily on the podium. The hosts award you with a sizable pile of scrap.

The race starts with a bang, your own spider managing to keep up with the frontrunners. You watch as your spider bobs and weaves through all the obstacles, keeping a good pace. It's a tense, close race all the way through. Each of your crew members cheer as your spider darts closer and closer to the finish line. Just near the end, your spider gains one final burst of speed necessary to pass the finish line. Your spider won! "And there's your winner! Charlie Brown from outta town takes it! A stunning upset!" You're awarded 100 scrap for your spider's effort.

The race starts with a bang, your own spider managing to keep up with the frontrunners. Having to deal with the speed of the other spiders and navigating the obstacles is difficult. Your spider struggles to keep amidst the frontrunner spiders - but keeps up all the same. As the spiders get near the finish line, your spider goes all out to barely eke out a second place victory. The emcee announces the winner, but you celebrate your spider's silver medal with the rest of the crewmates. As the runner up, you still get a modest reward.

The race starts, and your spider does its best. However, as much as it keeps up, the lack of experience is obvious, and your spider doesn't manage to make its way to the front of the pack. Your spider puts in a valiant effort, but ultimately several spiders manage to make it to the finish line before yours does. It could have gone better, but your crewmates applaud your spider's effort.

The race starts, but your spider seems unprepared. It's quickly apparent that your spider is not a racer, and falls far behind the other spiders. Your spider puts in a half hearted effort to finish the race, but it's obvious even from the start it's going to finish among the last. Your spider returns, seeming sheepish.

The race starts, but... The crowd erupts in laughter as your spider sluggishly drags its way across the field. In a humiliating display, your spider doesn't even manage to finish the race before being dragged off the field. The people aren't going to forget your embarrassing display any time soon.

event.name: START_NEXUS_4
event.text: "Did your Sylvan... put you up to thissss, ssstranger? Or did they attempt to... ssstop you? It isss very important we understand what... hands we left your reality in."
"Oh... I ssssee now. Ssso you really don't know... where you are. Oh... oh my. You poor creature... Well, I wissssh no cruelty upon you, ssstranger. Would you like an... explanation?"

G-Van shuffles his papers around and slips out a cartooney infographic, labeling various points on what is presumably the Multiverse. "Currently, sssstranger, you will find yourssself to be within what we call... the "Nexussss". Thisss isss the functional... center of the Multiversssse. Long ago, the Ssssylvansss of the Multiverssse disscovered thisss place thanksss to the help of our... leader, Ssssylvan Prime. At firssst we essstablished merely a... trade alliance, but sssoon when we realized the threatssss held within the Multiverssse it became clear it would be our... resssponssibility to protect it as well."
"To protect the Multiverssse from sssaid threatsss, we founded the C.E.L. - That isss... the Continuity Enforcement League. Unfortunately for you, sssstranger, part of the C.E.L.'sss sssacred... creed issss that we cannot allow anyone elssse to enter or leave the Nexussss... Which meansss, unfortunately, my only option now isss to... eliminate you."

Irwin seems dumbfounded for a moment, dropping his blunderbuss and stretching his eyestalks with his tentacles. "Oh my god. Holy ssshit. Holy actual ssshit. I WASSSS RIGHT! I WASSS RIGHT THISSS ENTIRE TIME! THEY CALLED ME A LUNATIC, ABSSSOLUTELY OUT OF MY MIND! And yet here we are! Even more, it'sss YOU! SSSYLVAN! You ssslimy traitorous asssshole. I ssshould have killed you the minute I met you. But oh... oh I'm gonna make you pay. I'm gonna make all of you god damn freaksss pay for taking EVERYTHING from me! YOU WILL RUE THE DAY YOU MESSSSED WITH IRWIN!"
G-Van seems utterly confused at this outburst. "Uh... I'm afraid I don't know who you... are...?" Irwin nods. "Oh, but you will. You will know exactly who I am after thissss." Irwin picks up his blunderbuss and brandishes it, ready to use it to obliterate any Sylvan in his path. With no other options left, you get ready to fight. Unfortunately, your systems are still offline, and you aren't sure how much of a chance you'll stand despite your crew's... "enthusiasm".

"Very well then. I ssshall get right to busssinesss then. By dictate of our divine leader, Ssssylvan Prime, the mossst sssacred rule of our creed isss that no one besssidesss ourssselvesss may ever enter or leave thisss place. Thusss... I'm afraid I will now have to... eliminate you."

event.name: FILLER_CLAIRVOYANT
event.text: The yellow ship at this beacon startles you, and you realise it's a Clairvoyant! You assume it must be lost, being so far away from a nebula.
The Slugs, confident in their ability to take you, make no attempt to get away and engage you directly in combat.
"Eugh... Federation... Yessss, we are lossst. No need to rub it in. We were chassssing ssssome filthy Fed- er.... criminalsss and wandered too far. Much too far. Could you ssspare ssssome fuel?"
The Slug quickly scoops up the fuel and brings it back to his ship.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug make the trade.

event.text: "One of ussss? My missstake... I did not think fellow Kleptocrianssss journeyed out thissss far intentionally..."
Knowing you have a Slug aboard your vessel, the Clairvoyants seem much more open, and you feel confident enough to accept their payment without suspecting some kind of trick.

choice.text: (Upg. Weapons) Keep your weapons powered while making the trade.

event.text: "I sssee you flexing your weaponssss over there, Feddy boy. You can put thossse away, I jusssst need the fuel..."
Knowing you're armed to the teeth, you doubt the Clairvoyants will try anything, and you feel confident enough to accept their payment without suspecting some kind of trick.
It's too risky approaching an Elite vessel like this.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_JOB
event.text: What task do you wish to perform?

choice.text: You cannot lay traps without a Mine Launcher and enough time.
Lay a trap for the fleet.

event.name: PINNACLE_SHIPYARDS_3
event.text: "As a matter of fact, yes. You see, as part of the acquiring of Pinnacle, W.I. collected and stored several of our sentient weapons - my children - in permanent hibernation to be deployed only in dire situations. I was fine with this at first. After witnessing the damage they created while malfunctioning during the Vek crisis, I understood it was a necessary step to keep them offline for the forseeable future. Unfortunately, I have now become privy to disturbing information. It seems W.I. has begun trade negotiations with Universe 1 to incorporate my children as part of some new secret military campaign. I cannot allow this. My kind will no longer be involved in the bloody wars of the flesh. I require the assistance of a strongman such as yourself to break into W.I.'s storage facilities and free my children. I will compensate you greatly so long as we keep this transaction off the books." Finally, you hear a break in the monotony of the voice, as Zenith is clearly upset by the information she has revealed to you.

choice.text: Hold on - YOUR kind? What does that mean?

event.text: "Forgive my misuse of language. But it is irrelevant to the conversation. I do not care if you wish to help or not: I only seek a response."

event.name: SPIDER_RACE_SPIDER_CHOICE
event.text: "And tell me, which of your lovely Spiders will you be entering today?"

"Oh my! Is that the queen of the spiders? How impressive! She looks quite big, though. She might be able to handle the obstacles, but in terms of raw speed, she'll be outclassed by most of her progeny! Let's see what she's got in store."
Your Spider skitters down to the tracks. The race is about to start. The announcer begins to count down. "3... 2... 1..."

"Good heavens! What on earth is this? This spider sends a chill down my spine... just as all spiders should! Only some crazy advanced alternative Brood could have come up with this, we are truly among a friend!"

"Good heavens! What on earth is this? This spider sends a chill down my spine... just as all spiders should! Only some crazy advanced alternative Brood could have come up with this, we are truly among a friend!"

"Counter-intuitive choice, I must say. Weavers are known to be much less swift than other spider species... but their intelligence is surprisingly great. I can't say I'm expecting you'll win, but you could certainly have something up your sleeve."
"Naturally. The common adult spider is the spider of choice for this contest. Very fast, capable of racing. Let's see how good it races."

"Hmm, let me guess. You think that because hatchlings are the fastest, it'll be able to win? Well, you're not the first to try it, but I'll warn you that the obstacles that your spider will have to navigate around are pretty tough for an inexperienced hatchling. But we'll see, even the smallest contestants can pull through."

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_SYSTEM
event.text: What system do you want to upgrade? [Viewing an upgrade will tell you its details before you buy it] [CAUTION: Limited reactor bars hinders the reactor requirements of upgrades]
You install the upgrade.

event.name: KESTREL_UNLOCK_OFFER_KESTREL
event.text: "Huh? That old thing? Oh, I can most certainly part ways with it. I jumped on purchasing one when they saw a sudden resurgence in popularity at the end of the Civil War, but now it seems everyone has one. Good deal then. One last thing - I've programmed the coordinates for the pirate ship into my assistant, Gana. He's just a machine, and not a very personable one at that, but he'll be sufficiently useful in combat. Best of luck captain. Godspeed!"

event.name: MONK_EYE_OPTIONS
event.text: It is said the monolith has strange, unpredictable powers. Those who can get it to speak to them may find many wonders or horrors that await.

choice.text: Speak to the Monolith and await your fate.
You've heard the tales of beings who vanish without a trace when speaking to the Monolith... you're not interested in meeting the same fate.
Make an offering to the Great Eye.

event.text: You toss some scrap towards the Great Eye, wondering if something will occur. Unfortunately, nothing seems to. Perhaps those old Zoltan myths are false? Maybe it's worth another try?

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Pray to the Eye for a chance at better rewards.
(Obelisk Crew) Your Obelisk recognizes this structure.

event.text: "This structure was an early design of an Obelisk Reality Manipulator. You can probably guess what it does from the name. Strange it ended up here, but I suppose this explains why the monolith can supposedly do all kinds of strange things. We could bring it aboard and I can make some repairs, but I doubt the Zoltans would appreciate it."

As you bring aboard the Reality Manipulator, a Zoltan Peacekeeper stops you. "You dare disturb the Great Eye? You have insulted our entire species, not to mention the divine creators! You will be punished!"
It's tempting, but not worth the risk to mess with an item worshipped and valued so highly by the Zoltans.
Your mission is to save the Federation, not discover new wonders around the galaxy. You prepare to jump.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_ORCHID
event.text: You are viewing the lab menu for: [ORCHID]

choice.text: Currently Installed: Petrified Wood. [Remove fire damage penalty, -10 Max Health]
Currently Installed: Totipotency. [+15% extra fire damage, but regenerate 3hp/s if unharmed for 4 seconds]
Pri: Thorns. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Petrified Wood. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Totipotency. [An upgrade is already installed]
Sec [Caretaker]: Calming Spores. [An upgrade is already installed] [Caretakers provide fire and stun immunity to nearby allies and themselves but no longer generate oxygen]
Sec [Vampweed]: Decomposers. [An upgrade is already installed] [Vampweeds prevent all non-Vampweeds in the room (friend or foe) from healing]

event.name: CURA_TASK_MENU
event.text: Please select a task difficulty. Available tasks are randomized, and can be rerolled once per jump.

choice.text: There are no Easy Tasks available.
There are no Intermediate Tasks available.
There are no Hard Tasks available.
Renegade, I have a special task for you.

event.name: START_NEXUS_2
event.text: Once fully conscious you check the ship's vital systems but find everything has been shut down. A strangely colored Slug transport lingers nearby, and before you can react you hear a cough from behind you. You spin around to find a Slug dressed in an ironed suit and tie sitting at a makeshift folding table, holding a briefcase and a stack of papers. "Hello... ssstranger. Would you care to... have a ssseat?"

choice.text: Try to get a word in.
Wait for her to calm down.
Nod to try and appease her.

event.text: "Fine. I've made my point. Now what do you have to say for yourself?"

choice.text: I've heard you out, but I'm still going to do it.

event.text: Mayeb puts her vines on her hips. "I don't think so! There's more that I have to say, and you're going to listen to me until you learn your lesson."
Mayeb folds her vines. "Say it more clearly. What are you apologizing for?"

choice.text: I'm sorry for thoughtlessly endangering the lives of children.

event.text: "Good. Now let's get the hell out of here."

event.name: MTBOSS_SPIDERC_DROP
event.text: You're also surprised to find a survivor amongst the wreckage! Seems to be some kind of bizarre, mutant spider. A small chip in the back of its head grants you control over it once you find a conveniently placed control pad that also survived the fight. Maybe this creature will prove to be useful?

event.name: MTBOSS_HORSEC_DROP
event.text: You're also surprised to find a survivor amongst the wreckage! "Neigggh! I am a [horse]! Horsie -horsie- yay! Snort snort!" It seems it's actually an Engi pretending to be a horse, but you don't have the heart to tell it otherwise. They seem willing to work with you though.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LEARN
event.text: At various opportunities you will be given the option to check your storage and do various actions onboard your ship. This can happen in situations such as visiting stores, revisiting an explored beacon, or choosing not to interact with an event. It may look overwhelming at first, but eventually you'll become accustomed to the system. To learn about internal upgrades or the onboard lab, visit the database entries under their respective tabs.

Here you may view accomplishments throughout the run and lore entries related to them. The mission report tracks bosses defeated, Renegades encountered, loot items found, and unique crew recruited. The mission report provides no practical benefit but can provide insight on just what you've done along your journey!

You may also choose to engage in various tasks. By default, you'll be able to run salvage missions and repair your hull, but if you find a Mine Launcher weapon you can also lay a trap for the fleet before sector 8. Salvage missions have many different outcomes, some good and some bad, but can turn up valuable loot. Repairing the hull may be less efficient than at a store, but it can get you out of a tight spot.

event.name: STORAGE_CHECK_LAB_LEECH
event.text: You are viewing the lab menu for: [LEECH]

choice.text: Currently Installed: Burrows. [+50% movement speed and ignore doors]
Currently Installed: High Voltage [+1 power in the occupied system, +50% stun duration, +33% fire and suffocation damage]
Currently Installed: Parasitical Dependencies. [-60 Max Health and 4x less combat damage, but steal 3hp/s from enemy non-Leech crew in the room.]
Pri: Burrows. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: High Voltage. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Parasitical Dependencies. [An upgrade is already installed]

Currently Installed: Elastic Surface. [+60% movement speed and ignore doors]
Currently Installed: Hulking Mass. [+50% Max Health, -50% movement speed]
Pri: Neoprene Membrane. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Elastic Surface. [An upgrade is already installed]
Pri: Hulking Mass. [An upgrade is already installed]
Sec [Tech]: Robotic Mimickry. [An upgrade is already installed] [Technopaths heal for 6.4hp/s in your Drone Control system while it is powered]

event.name: SYLVAN_NARRATOR_END
event.text: Okay, okay, this is going to take too long. We can stop there. But oh, Renegade, this has been just splendid! Oh I feel terrible I didn't prepare a gift for you. I tell you what. Come visit me again, and I'll have something just wonderful prepared, alright? Goodbye, Renegade! I hope to see you again in the future.

With the strange meeting over, the Renegade prepared to move on. He waved a tearful goodbye to Narrator Sylvan, choked up with sadness he had to part ways, and only hoping they would meet again some day.

With the strange meeting over, the Renegade prepared to move on. She waved a tearful goodbye to Narrator Sylvan, choked up with sadness she had to part ways, and only hoping they would meet again some day.

With the strange meeting over, the Renegade prepared to move on. They waved a tearful goodbye to Narrator Sylvan, choked up with sadness they had to part ways, and only hoping they would meet again some day.
